data.title: cocos2d-x js-test IOS
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.13.1
- devices test on: ios simulator ---iphone5s/ios9.3
- developing environments
  - NDK version:
  - Xcode version:7.3.1
  - VS version:
  - brower type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. run  js-test IOS.
2. play chipmunk test and tap screen to create many Collisions.
3. play chipmunk test to Chipmunk Collision Test{using setDefaultCollisionHandler}(debug on).
4. tap next arrow.
5. game will crash in :

bool ScriptingCore::forceGC(JSContext *cx, uint32_t argc, jsval *vp)
{
    JSRuntime *rt = JS_GetRuntime(cx);
    JS_GC(rt);//<<====crash here.
    return true;
}

data.title: Removed unnecessary comments
data.body:
This PR removes several unnecessary comments to avoid clutter. It also fixes the following warnings when compiling using clang with `-Wdocumentation` compiler option.

```
cocos/2d/CCActionCamera.h:47:51: warning: not a Doxygen trailing comment [-Wdocumentation]
class CC_DLL ActionCamera : public ActionInterval //<NSCopying> 
                                                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~
                                                  ///<
cocos/2d/CCActionCamera.h:120:48: warning: not a Doxygen trailing comment [-Wdocumentation]
class CC_DLL OrbitCamera : public ActionCamera //<NSCopying> 
                                               ^~~~~~~~~~~~
                                               ///<
cocos/2d/CCActionInstant.h:44:54: warning: not a Doxygen trailing comment [-Wdocumentation]
class CC_DLL ActionInstant : public FiniteTimeAction //<NSCopying>
                                                     ^~~~~~~~~~~~
                                                     ///<
cocos/2d/CCActionInstant.h:279:43: warning: not a Doxygen trailing comment [-Wdocumentation]
class CC_DLL Place : public ActionInstant //<NSCopying>
                                          ^~~~~~~~~~~~
                                          ///<
cocos/2d/CCActionInstant.h:318:46: warning: not a Doxygen trailing comment [-Wdocumentation]
class CC_DLL CallFunc : public ActionInstant //<NSCopying>
                                             ^~~~~~~~~~~~
                                             ///<
extensions/GUI/CCControlExtension/CCControl.cpp:187:5: warning: not a Doxygen trailing comment [-Wdocumentation]
    //<Invocation*>
    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
    ///<
```

Thanks!

data.title: [jsb] XHR 'timeout' property not affects HttpClient timeout
Cannot build in Release mode: wrong missing libatomic.a error cocos2d-x
data.body:
Hello everybody,
I am using cocos2d-x v3.13 and the NDK r11c, and I have a project that is working perfectly when building it in debug mode (using "cocos run -p android"). Since the project is going well, I wanted to try a release compilation to see if I get a significant perf boost.
So I ran "cocos run -p android -m release" and I get a weird compilation error:

```
    D:/WORK/Tools/Softwares/Development/android-ndk-r11c-windows-x86_64/android-ndk-r11c/build//../toolchains/arm-linux-androideabi-4.9/prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-androideabi/4.9/../../../../arm-linux-androideabi/bin/ld.exe: error: cannot open D:/WORK/Tools/Softwares/Development/android-ndk-r11c-windows-x86_64/android-ndk-r11c/build//../toolchains/arm-linux-androideabi-4.9/prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-androideabi/4.9/../../../../arm-linux-androideabi/lib/armv7-a/thumb/libatomic.a: No such file or directory
    collect2.exe: error: ld returned 1 exit status
    make: *** [obj/local/armeabi-v7a/libMyGame.so] Error 1
    make: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
    make: Leaving directory `D:/WORK/Projets/Cocos2dX/AngryBomber/Sources/cocos_v3.13/AngryBomber/proj.android'
    Error running command, return code: 2.
```

So it says that there is a missing libatomic.a file.
However, the file is here, if I just dir the missing path:

```
    dir "D:/WORK/Tools/Softwares/Development/android-ndk-r11c-windows-x86_64/android-ndk-r11c/build//../toolchains/arm-linux-androideabi-4.9/prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-androideabi/4.9/../../../../arm-linux-androideabi/lib/armv7-a/thumb/"
     Volume in drive D is DATA
     Volume Serial Number is 6800-B561

     Directory of D:\WORK\Tools\Softwares\Development\android-ndk-r11c-windows-x86_64\android-ndk-r11c\toolchains\arm-linux-androideabi-4.9\prebuilt\windows-x86_64\arm-linux-androideabi\lib\armv7-a\thumb

    19/07/2016  15:49    <DIR>          .
    19/07/2016  15:49    <DIR>          ..
    19/07/2016  15:49    <DIR>          hard
    30/03/2016  18:20           403 424 libatomic.a
    30/03/2016  18:20           502 932 libgomp.a
    30/03/2016  18:20               153 libgomp.spec
                   3 File(s)        906 509 bytes
                   3 Dir(s)  73 893 457 920 bytes free
```

If the file was actually missing, I would get it, but it is just there, and all I did was add the "-m release" to the cocos run command...

However, if I remove "armeabi-v7a" from the APP_ABI line in the Application.mk file, then I can compile without any error.

Thank you for your help!

data.title: cc.Scale9Sprite setColor is not work
data.body:
I found a bug. Please fix it!

Cocos2d-x JS 3.13.1
Chrome 53.0.2785.143

Setting:
    1. create new project with js.
    2. app.js file's L.27 change
        `this.sprite = new cc.Scale9Sprite(res.HelloWorld_png,null,cc.rect(10,10,10,10));`
    3. Add L.28
        `this.sprite.setColor(cc.color(250,20,30));`
    4. Add modules "extensions" on project.json.
    5. Run project.

Sprite color shift a dark color during changing browser size.

I think UIScale9Sprite is recurring color control at redraw or update timing.

data.title: Removed COCOS2D_DEBUG from Android simulator on release build
data.body:
I don't think COCOS2D_DEBUG should be defined when building the project for Android simulator on release mode.

Related: #16559

data.title: Upgrade Box2D to latest version
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.13.1
- developing environments
  - Xcode version: Xcode 8.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Build libcocos2d project with Xcode, then the following warnings are generated.

```
external/Box2D/Common/b2Math.h:59:17: declaration shadows a field of 'b2Vec2' [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Common/b2Math.h:59:28: declaration shadows a field of 'b2Vec2' [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Common/b2Math.h:150:17: declaration shadows a field of 'b2Vec3' [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Common/b2Math.h:150:28: declaration shadows a field of 'b2Vec3' [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Common/b2Math.h:150:39: declaration shadows a field of 'b2Vec3' [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Common/b2Draw.h:28:18: declaration shadows a field of 'b2Color' [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Common/b2Draw.h:28:29: declaration shadows a field of 'b2Color' [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Common/b2Draw.h:28:40: declaration shadows a field of 'b2Color' [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Collision/b2CollideCircle.cpp:141:11: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Dynamics/b2Island.cpp:315:14: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
external/Box2D/Dynamics/Joints/b2WheelJoint.cpp:144:12: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
```

These warnings seem to have already been fixed in the latest Box2D that is hosted on github at https://github.com/erincatto/Box2D. I also tried to replace the old files with new ones which are downloaded from github into `external/Box2D`, and it works fine without any compiler warnings.

So could you please update Box2D to the latest master version?
Kindly consider.

data.title: Performance tweak: use range-based for-loops instead of iterator-based for-loops.
data.body:
The following error messages related to the ++ and -- operators are shown by `cppcheck`:

```
[2d/CCAutoPolygon.cpp:517]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[2d/CCAutoPolygon.cpp:556]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[2d/CCAutoPolygon.cpp:572]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[2d/CCAutoPolygon.cpp:588]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[audio/win32/SimpleAudioEngine.cpp:86]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[audio/win32/SimpleAudioEngine.cpp:208]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[audio/win32/SimpleAudioEngine.cpp:226]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[audio/win32/SimpleAudioEngine.cpp:235]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[editor-support/cocosbuilder/CCNodeLoaderLibrary.cpp:73]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[editor-support/cocostudio/CCActionManagerEx.cpp:170]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[editor-support/cocostudio/CCDataReaderHelper.cpp:508]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[network/HttpClient-android.cpp:470]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[network/HttpClient-android.cpp:508]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[platform/linux/CCDevice-linux.cpp:265]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
[scripting/js-bindings/manual/ScriptingCore.cpp:669]: (performance) Prefer prefix ++/-- operators for non-primitive types.
```

This pull request is rather self-explanatory, but prefixing ++ for non-primitive data types will yield a performance boost.

data.title: Fix typos in doc: accpetable / accepteable -> acceptable
data.body:
This pull request fixes some minor typos found while reading in LuaBasicConversions.
- `accpetable` -> `acceptable`
- `accepteable` -> `acceptable`
- `coversion` -> `conversion`

Thanks!

data.title: Remove unused functions
data.body:
Hello, I get the following warnings during compilation with libcocos2d under Xcode 8.0.

```
cocos/2d/CCDrawNode.cpp:79:20: warning: unused function 'v2fforangle' [-Wunused-function]
extensions/physics-nodes/CCPhysicsDebugNode.cpp:71:14: warning: unused function 'cpVertArray2ccpArrayN' [-Wunused-function]
```

These functions don't seem to be used anywhere, and I think we can remove them because they are `static` function that has internal linkage. So this pull request removes them to prevent the compiler warnings.

Thanks.

data.title: [Label] If getLetter() is called on a shrunk text, the letter will keep the original size (before shrinking)
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.13.1
- devices test on: All

[Label] When text is shrunk (using Overflow SHRINK), if getLetter() method is called, the letter will keep its original size (without shrinking), looking like this:

![screen shot 2016-10-03 at 10 55 17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8377637/19040039/c4898936-8958-11e6-87ee-cc6a28e1dad8.png)

The getLetter() method was used in the first letter as it can be seen on the screenshot. Note the first letter is bigger than the others.

data.title: Layer->setRotation3D seems to break touch event target
Adding 'addImageAsyncImmediate' to CCTextureCache.
data.body:
This will allow engine users to load multiple textures async across multiple threads, or load a texture before other textures in the texture loading queue.

In several of our cocos2d-x projects, we found that increasing the number of texture loading threads would reduce our loading times by a measurable amount. We found that the cleanest way to accomplish this was adding a "loadImageAsyncImmediate" function, which will spin up a new thread dedicated to loading that texture. This is designed to mimic the architecture of HttpClient::sendImmediate. 

This feature should be almost entirely additive, and have minimal impact to users who do not opt-in to this new functionality. 

Benefits: 
- On systems with a high core count, using this may yield solid performance gains in texture load times.
- Engine users can prioritize texture loads over others.

data.title: fix for #16589
data.body: Tested on CLion/CMake and XCode, iOS and macOS targets.

data.title: System font enhancements on OSX and macOS
data.body:
this was reported on the forums: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/labels-with-system-fonts-on-macos/32394

My understanding is `SystemFont` is a label type that uses the default `system font` and `font size`. This is a font that is meant not to have its properties changed. You should think of it as **system font, system rules**.

User is asking if this behavior can be changed and provides some thoughts in the thread on how to change it.

- developing environments
  - VS version: vs2015 version 14.0.25431.01 update 3
  - Visual C++ 2015 00322-900053-9539-AA717
  - CMake 3.6.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Create a new project with cocos console in order to get the template ready, generate with CMake for vs 2015, try to build.
2. An error will raise when trying to compile in main.cpp since cannot found APIENTRY and _tWinMain in: int APIENTRY _tWinMain(HINSTANCE hInstance, HINSTANCE hPrevInstance, LPTSTR lpCmdLine, int  nCmdShow)
3. Replace this for int  _tmain(HINSTANCE hInstance, HINSTANCE hPrevInstance, LPTSTR lpCmdLine, int  nCmdShow) and now is working

data.title: Defining CC_USE_PHYSICS to 1 by default is wrong
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1

I use cocos2dx with **only** Box2D.

So I disabled default use of `chipmunk, bullet, recast` via adding following configuration options to my project `CMakeLists.txt`:

```
SET( USE_SOURCES_EXTERNAL ON CACHE BOOL "Use some libraries from cocos2dx externals" )
SET( USE_CHIPMUNK OFF CACHE BOOL "Turn off default ChipMunk (2D physics)" )
SET( USE_BULLET OFF CACHE BOOL "Turn off Bullet (3d physics)" )
SET( USE_RECAST OFF CACHE BOOL "Turn off Recast (3d pathfinding)" )
SET( USE_BOX2D ON CACHE BOOL "Turn on Box2D for 2D physics" )

```

cocos2dx library compiling is OK.
my project compiling is OK.

But, when I try to use default camera object from any scene, I got SEGFAULT.

```
auto camera = cocos2d::Director::getInstance()->getRunningScene()->getDefaultCamera();
auto position = camera->getPosition();
```

My "small" investigation (8 hrs) lead me to `cocos2d::Node` (parent class of`cocos2d::Scene`).

I found out that there is a block of code, covered with `#ifdef CC_USE_PHYSICS`:

```
#if CC_USE_PHYSICS
    PhysicsBody* _physicsBody; 
    ...
#endif
```

Because `USE_CHIPMUNK` is set to `OFF` in my configuration, cocos2dx cmake module defines `CC_USE_PHYSICS` to `0`, **add_definitions(-DCC_USE_PHYSICS=0)** (see `cmake\Modules\SetCompilerOptions.cmake`):

```
    # definitions for chipmunk
    if (USE_CHIPMUNK)
        add_definitions(-DCC_ENABLE_CHIPMUNK_INTEGRATION=1)
        if (IOS OR MACOSX)
            # without this chipmunk will try to use apple defined geometry types, that conflicts with cocos
            add_definitions(-DCP_USE_CGPOINTS=0)
        endif()
    else()
        add_definitions(-DCC_USE_PHYSICS=0)
    endif()
```

So cocos2d library is compiled with `CC_USE_PHYSICS=0` and with absent field `_physicsBody` in `cocos2d::Node` class definition. 

My project compiles with undefined CC_USE_PHYSICS.
(BTW I don't think it's good practice to add any library related definitions to my project.)

Let's look into `cocos/base/ccConfig.h`: 

```
/*\* Use physics integration API. */
# ifndef CC_USE_PHYSICS
# define CC_USE_PHYSICS 1
# endif
```
So in my project cocos2d config defines `CC_USE_PHYSICS` to `1`.

That's why my declaration of class is different from declaration of class cocos2d library was compiled with.
That leads to `sizeof(PhysicsBody*)` offset for **all** member fields in **all** classes that are inherited from `cocos2d::Node`, resulting in accessing wrong memory.

**I would be glad if you could change the way CC_USE_PHYSICS is defined, or in best get rid of it.** 
I didn't come up with any good idea, it's up to you of course to figure out best possibilities.
At least you can add a comment to cocos2d cmake about _the need_ to define CC_USE_PHYSICS at project, when user disables Chipmunk usage.
It can save a lot of time to many folks around.
It's wasn't that easy to understand what was going on in first place. And newbie developers can stuck at all.

P.S. As for me, you can provide users with some variable (i.e. `CC_CXX_FLAGS`), so users project can update theirs `CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS`.

./cpp-tests: symbol lookup error: ./cpp-tests: undefined symbol: _ZN4FMOD14ChannelControl9setPausedEb

data.title: Memory leak in JSB when using repeat, repeatForever or easing functions on actions
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.11 and 3.13.1
- devices test on: iPhone 6, iOS Simulator iOS 9.3
- developing environments
  - Xcode version: 7.3.1

Steps to Reproduce:
You can see this by running the JS-Tests project, set breakpoints on these destructors:
Sequence::~Sequence 
Repeat::~Repeat

Go to the Action Tests. Run the Sequence.repeat() test. After the three repeats, the destructors will only fire once even though there are two sequences and two repeat actions in the test. The one that fires corresponds to the direct creation of the repeat action: 

ActionTests.js, line 2605
`this._kathia.runAction(cc.repeat(cc.sequence(cc.blink(2, 3), cc.delayTime(2)), 3));`

As opposed to chaining the repeat function on the sequence action (which is where the leak occurs):

ActionTests.js, line 2610
`this._tamara.runAction(move_seq.repeat(3));`

Corresponding forum post here - http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/memory-leak-in-jsb-when-using-repeat-repeatforever-or-easing-functions-on-actions/32430

data.title: AudioEngine bug - setCurrentTime error
data.body:
Test platform: windows 10
1. Call audioEngine->play2d
2. Immediately set current time audioEngine->setCurrentTime

For the first time: Invalid time setting
The second time: Will start playing a section from 0, then jump to the specified time

anticipate result:
  Start playing from the specified time

data.title: FileUtils::createDirectory() on MacOS fails to create directory (APP SANDBOX)
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.10 and supposedly to 3.13
- devices test on: Mac Mini
- developing environment:
  - Xcode version: XCode 8.0
  - OSX 10.11 El Capitan
- mac app: APP SANDBOX ACTIVATED

Steps to Reproduce:

Execute Code: 
std::string folder_path = "/Users/[USER]/Library/Containers/[APP_ID]/Data/Documents/newfolder/"
FileUtils::getInstance()->createDirectory(folder_path)
--> Returns false
--> Folder is not created

Assumed reason:

The createDirectory function tries to create all subdirectories that don't exist. It begins with the root folder '/' and checks existence by 'openDir' (Line 1132). 'openDir' FAILS (returns NULL) for '/'. Therefore it is assumed that '/' does not exist and the subsequent 'mkdir' for '/' fails of course aborting the function by returning false.

I guess that SANDBOX Apps are not allowed to READ '/' because 'openDir' fails?
